==Events==
<!-- Please don't Wikify years that have already been linked -->
* [[211]] &ndash; [[Publius Septimius Geta]], co-emperor of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], is lured to come without his bodyguards to meet his brother [[Caracalla|Marcus Aurelius Antoninus (Caracalla)]], to discuss a possible reconciliation. When he arrives, the [[Praetorian Guard]] murders him and he dies in the arms of his mother, [[Julia Domna]].
* [[324]] &ndash; [[Licinius]] abdicates his position as [[List of Roman emperors|Roman Emperor]].
*[[1154]] &ndash; [[Henry II of England]] is crowned at [[Westminster Abbey]].
*[[1490]] &ndash; [[Anne of Brittany|Anne, Duchess of Brittany]], is married to [[Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor]] by [[proxy marriage|proxy]].
*[[1562]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Dreux]] takes place during the [[French Wars of Religion]].
*[[1606]] &ndash; The ''[[Susan Constant]]'', the ''[[Godspeed (ship)|Godspeed]]'', and the ''[[Discovery (1602 ship)|Discovery]]'' depart England carrying settlers who found, at [[Jamestown, Virginia]], the first of the [[Thirteen Colonies|thirteen colonies]] that became the United States.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Thomas Paine]] publishes one of a series of pamphlets in ''[[The Pennsylvania Journal]]'' entitled "[[The American Crisis]]".
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[George Washington]]'s [[Continental Army]] goes into winter quarters at [[Valley Forge|Valley Forge, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[French Revolutionary Wars]]: Two British frigates under Commodore [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Horatio Nelson]] and two Spanish frigates under Commodore Don Jacobo Stuart [[Action of 19 December 1796|engage in battle]] off the coast of [[Murcia]].
*[[1828]] &ndash; [[Nullification Crisis]]: [[Vice President of the United States]] [[John C. Calhoun]] pens the ''[[South Carolina Exposition and Protest]]'', protesting the [[Tariff of 1828]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Hopetoun Blunder]]: The first [[Governor-General of Australia]] [[John Hope, 1st Marquess of Linlithgow|John Hope, 7th Earl of Hopetoun]], appoints Sir [[William Lyne]] premier of the new state of [[New South Wales]], but he is unable to persuade other colonial politicians to join his government and is forced to resign.
*[[1907]] &ndash; 239 coal miners die in a mine explosion in [[Jacobs Creek (Pennsylvania)|Jacobs Creek, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; William Van Schaick, captain of the [[Steamboat|steamship]] ''[[PS General Slocum|General Slocum]]'' which caught fire and killed over 1,000 people, is pardoned by U.S. President [[William Howard Taft]] after three-and-a-half-years in [[Sing Sing]] prison.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Verdun]] &ndash; On the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]], the [[French Army]] successfully holds off the [[German Army#World War I 1914–1918|German Army]] and drives it back to its starting position.
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Constantine I of Greece|King Constantine I]] is restored as [[Kingdom of Greece|King of the Hellenes]] after the death of his son [[Alexander of Greece]] and a [[Referendum|plebiscite]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; The last [[Rolls-Royce Silver Ghost]] is sold in London, England.
*[[1927]] &ndash; Three Indian revolutionaries, [[Ram Prasad Bismil]], [[Roshan Singh]] and [[Ashfaqulla Khan]] are executed by the [[British Empire]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[BBC World Service]] begins broadcasting as the BBC Empire Service.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Adolf Hitler]] becomes Supreme [[Commander-in-chief]] of the [[German Army (1935–1945)|German Army]].
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: [[Limpet mine]]s placed by [[Italian Navy|Italian]] divers heavily damage the {{HMS|Valiant|1914|6}} and {{HMS|Queen Elizabeth|1913|6}} in [[Raid on Alexandria (1941)|Alexandria harbour]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; Start of the [[First Indochina War]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; Irish-born physician [[John Bodkin Adams]] is arrested in connection with the suspicious deaths of more than 160 patients. Eventually he is convicted only of minor charges.
*[[1961]] &ndash; India [[1961 Indian annexation of Goa|annexes]] [[Daman and Diu]], part of [[Portuguese India]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam|South Vietnamese military junta]] of [[Nguyễn Khánh]] [[December 1964 South Vietnamese coup|dissolve the High National Council]] and arrest some of the members.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Harold Holt]], the [[Prime Minister of Australia]], is [[Declared death in absentia|officially presumed dead]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: The last manned lunar flight, [[Apollo 17]], crewed by [[Eugene Cernan]], [[Ron Evans]] and [[Harrison Schmitt]], returns to [[Earth]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Nelson Rockefeller]] is sworn in as [[Vice President of the United States]] under President [[Gerald Ford]] under the provisions of the twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[John Paul Stevens]] is appointed a justice of the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Geoffrey Boycott]] became the first [[cricketer]] to be stranded at 99 not out against Australia at [[Perth]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; Sixteen lives are lost when the [[Penlee lifeboat disaster|Penlee lifeboat]] goes to the aid of the stricken coaster Union Star in heavy seas.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The original [[FIFA World Cup]] trophy, the [[FIFA World Cup Trophy#Jules Rimet Trophy|Jules Rimet Trophy]], is stolen from the headquarters of the [[Brazilian Football Confederation]] in [[Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil.
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[Sino-British Joint Declaration]], stating that China would resume the exercise of sovereignty over Hong Kong and the United Kingdom would restore Hong Kong to China with effect from July 1, 1997 is signed in Beijing, China by [[Deng Xiaoping]] and [[Margaret Thatcher]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Mikhail Gorbachev]], leader of the [[Soviet Union]], releases [[Andrei Sakharov]] and his wife from [[exile]] in [[Nizhny Novgorod|Gorky]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The United States Government restores federal recognition to the [[Nottawaseppi Huron Band of Potawatomi]] Indian tribe.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[SilkAir Flight 185]] crashes into the [[Musi River (Indonesia)|Musi River]], near [[Palembang]] in [[Indonesia]], killing 104.
*[[1998]] &ndash; President [[Bill Clinton]] is [[Impeachment of Bill Clinton|impeached]] by the [[United States House of Representatives]], becoming the second President of the United States to be [[impeached]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; The Leninist Guerrilla Units wing of the [[Communist Labour Party of Turkey/Leninist]] attack a [[Nationalist Movement Party]] office in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]], killing one person and injuring three.
*[[2001]] &ndash; A record high [[Atmospheric pressure|barometric pressure]] of 1085.6 [[Pascal (unit)|hPa]] (32.06 [[Inch of mercury|inHg]]) is recorded at [[Tosontsengel, Khövsgöl]], [[Mongolia]].
*  2001   &ndash; [[Argentine economic crisis (1999–2002)|Argentine economic crisis]]: [[December 2001 riots in Argentina|December 2001 riots]] &ndash; Riots erupt in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Sachin Tendulkar]] scores a record-breaking 50th Century in [[Test cricket]] against South Africa at the [[SuperSport Park]] in [[Centurion, Gauteng]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Rahul Dravid]] crosses the 12000 runs milestone in [[Test cricket]] against South Africa at the [[SuperSport Park]] in [[Centurion, Gauteng]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Park Geun-hye]] [[South Korean presidential election, 2012|becomes]] the first female [[president of South Korea]].
